  • Constructor Details

    • TaskBean

      public TaskBean()

  • Method Details

    • createDefaultTasksIfNotExistent

      public void createDefaultTasksIfNotExistent()
      Automatically generates a predefined set of tasks for each project if they do not already exist. This method is intended to be run at application startup to ensure that there are default tasks available for demonstration or initial use.

    • getTasksSuggestions

      public List<TaskSuggestionDto> getTasksSuggestions(String sessionId, String systemProjectName) throws Exception
      Provides a list of task suggestions for a given project and user session. This can be used to suggest tasks to users based on their current project context.
      Parameters:
      sessionId - The session ID of the user requesting suggestions.
      systemProjectName - The system name of the project for which suggestions are being requested.
      Returns:
      A list of TaskSuggestionDto objects representing the suggested tasks.
      Throws:
      Exception - if the project or user cannot be found, or if the user is not part of the project.

    • getTasksPageDto

      public TasksPageDto getTasksPageDto(String sessionId, String systemProjectName) throws Exception
      Retrieves a detailed view of tasks for a given project, formatted for display on a page. This includes tasks details, project members, and the current user's role within the project.
      Parameters:
      sessionId - The session ID of the user.
      systemProjectName - The system name of the project for which the task page is being requested.
      Returns:
      A TasksPageDto object containing detailed information about the project's tasks.
      Throws:
      Exception - if the project or user cannot be found, or if the user is not part of the project.

    • addTask

      public void addTask(String sessionId, UpdateTaskDto updateTaskDto) throws ProjectNotFoundException, UserNotFoundException, UserNotInProjectException
      Adds a new task to the system based on provided details. This method handles task creation, including setting up relationships with users and projects.
      Parameters:
      sessionId - The session ID of the user creating the task.
      updateTaskDto - An UpdateTaskDto object containing the details of the task to be added.
      Throws:
      ProjectNotFoundException - if the specified project cannot be found.
      UserNotFoundException - if the specified user cannot be found.
      UserNotInProjectException - if the user is not part of the specified project.

    • updateTask

      public void updateTask(String sessionId, UpdateTaskDto updateTaskDto) throws ProjectNotFoundException, UserNotFoundException, UserNotInProjectException
      Updates an existing task with new details. This method allows for modifying various aspects of a task, including its status, description, and associated users.
      Parameters:
      sessionId - The session ID of the user updating the task.
      updateTaskDto - An UpdateTaskDto object containing the updated details of the task.
      Throws:
      ProjectNotFoundException - if the specified project or task cannot be found.
      UserNotFoundException - if the specified user cannot be found.
      UserNotInProjectException - if the user is not part of the specified project.

    • checkDoubleNotification

      public boolean checkDoubleNotification(String taskTitle, String projectSystemName, String systemUsername, UserEntity user)
      Checks for duplicate notifications for a given task, project, and user within a short timeframe. This method is used to prevent spamming users with multiple notifications of the same type in quick succession.
      Parameters:
      taskTitle - The title of the task for which the notification is being checked.
      projectSystemName - The system name of the project related to the task.
      systemUsername - The username of the user in the system.
      user - The UserEntity object representing the user to check notifications for.
      Returns:
      true if a duplicate notification exists, false otherwise.

    • deleteTask

      public void deleteTask(String sessionId, UpdateTaskDto updateTaskDto) throws ProjectNotFoundException, UserNotFoundException, UserNotInProjectException
      Marks a task as deleted and adjusts project and task dependencies accordingly. This method is used to logically delete a task from the project, ensuring that any dependent tasks are updated to remove the deleted task from their dependencies.
      Parameters:
      sessionId - The session ID of the user performing the deletion.
      updateTaskDto - An UpdateTaskDto object containing the details of the task to be deleted.
      Throws:
      ProjectNotFoundException - if the specified project cannot be found.
      UserNotFoundException - if the specified user cannot be found.
      UserNotInProjectException - if the user is not part of the specified project.

    • removeUserFromProjectTasks

      public void removeUserFromProjectTasks(int userId, int projectId)
      Removes a user from all tasks within a project. This method is used when a user is removed from a project to ensure that they are also removed from any tasks within that project. If the user is in charge of a task, the project creator is set as the new in charge.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user being removed.
      projectId - The ID of the project from which the user is being removed.
